text: Now 2 million have signed the Stop Brexit petition... looking at who signed the 4 million one from 2016 is instructive...
author: BBCPeterH

text: A pleasure, and you had some great questions for us
author: BBCPeterH

text: Write your own captions!  Some cracking shots from Mark Duffy in PMQs today ©UK Parliament
author: BBCPeterH

text: Downing Street now confirming what the Chancellor said in Salisbury yesterday - UK asking for a short extension to #brexit, not enough time for second referendum
author: BBCPeterH

text: "It's a problem we will live with and we will work our way around" Chancellor Phillip Hammond tells me the government can "craft" a #brexit motion that will satisfy the speaker
author: BBCPeterH

text: Salisbury Cathedral looking glorious this evening
author: BBCPeterH

text: Do you remember when you joined Twitter? I do! #MyTwitterAnniversary
author: BBCPeterH

text: Chancellor Phillip Hammond has come to Salisbury Cathedral, big announcement on broadband for the city
author: BBCPeterH

text: Now Dorset's Sir Robert Syms is raising another Point of Order on Mr Speaker's ruling that a new vote must be a new choice - "Every member of this House expects to have a say on the type of Brexit we are going to have.. not to consider the matter again could have consequences."
author: BBCPeterH

text: Speaker says “a demonstrable change” is needed for New #brexit Vote in House of Commons. The choice “needs to be substantially different”
author: BBCPeterH

text: I may have lost my rag a little with the MPs when we recorded this week’s show. Blame Brexit. They are reasonable human beings, really. Cash for Schools, individual councillor choice cash pots  and, yes ... the *B*word .... from 11am BBC1 South
author: BBCPeterH
